revised_title: On the Supposed Existence of Metamorphoses in Crustacea
tldr: The author examines the supposed metamorphoses in crustaceans, specifically in the genus Zoea, and concludes that the transformations observed do not warrant the term metamorphosis. The author refutes the claims made by J. V. Thompson, who believed that these transformations were unique to crustaceans and different from insect metamorphoses.
